titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C26

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

body.ab: <milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0102__main__24"/> One evening I sat in my <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0102__main__d3e19078"/>chemic<del eID="c57-0102__main__d3e19078"/><lb n="c57-0102__main__25"/> workshop, the sun had set & the moon <lb n="c57-0102__main__26"/> was just rising from the sea — I had not <lb n="c57-0102__main__27"/> light sufficient for my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0102__main__d3e19090"/>work<del eID="c57-0102__main__d3e19090"/>employment and I sat <lb n="c57-0102__main__28"/> idle <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0102__main__d3e19099"/>mus<del eID="c57-0102__main__d3e19099"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0102__main__d3e19102"/>untill<del eID="c57-0102__main__d3e19102"/> in <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0102__main__d3e19107"/>the<del eID="c57-0102__main__d3e19107"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a pause of consideration <lb n="c57-0102__main__29"/> of whether I should leave my labour for <lb n="c57-0102__main__30"/> the night or hasten its conclusion by an <lb n="c57-0102__main__31"/> unremitting attention to it. As I sat a train <lb n="c57-0102__main__32"/> of reflection occur<mdel>e</mdel>red to me which led to me <lb n="c57-0102__main__33"/> consider the effects of what I was now <lb n="c57-0102__main__34"/> doing. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0102__main__d3e19145"/>Two<del eID="c57-0102__main__d3e19145"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>three years before I had been engaged <lb n="c57-0102__main__35"/> in the same manner & had created a <lb n="c57-0102__main__36"/> fiend whose unparralelled barbarity had<lb n="c57-0103__main__1"/> desolated my heart and filled it for<lb n="c57-0103__main__2"/>ever with the bitterest remorse. I was <lb n="c57-0103__main__3"/> now about to form another being of whose <lb n="c57-0103__main__4"/> dispositions I was alike ignorant. She <lb n="c57-0103__main__5"/> might be ten thousand times more ma<lb n="c57-0103__main__6"/>lignant than her mate and delight in <lb n="c57-0103__main__7"/> murder & wretchedness. He had sworn <lb n="c57-0103__main__8"/> to quit the neighbourhood of man & hide <lb n="c57-0103__main__9"/> himself in desarts but she had not &<lb n="c57-0103__main__10"/> she who was in all probability to become <lb n="c57-0103__main__11"/> a thinking & reasoning animal might <lb n="c57-0103__main__12"/> refuse to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0103__main__d3e19208"/>to<del eID="c57-0103__main__d3e19208"/> comply with a compact made <lb n="c57-0103__main__13"/> before her creation. They might even <lb n="c57-0103__main__14"/> hate one another. The creature who al<lb n="c57-0103__main__15"/>ready lived loathed his own deformity <lb n="c57-0103__main__16"/>& might he not conceive a greater ab<lb n="c57-0103__main__17"/>horrence for it when it came before <lb n="c57-0103__main__18"/> his eyes in the female form. She also <lb n="c57-0103__main__19"/> might turn with disgust from him <lb n="c57-0103__main__20"/> to the superior beauty of man & who <lb n="c57-0103__main__21"/> confine her eyes or wishes. She might <lb n="c57-0103__main__22"/> quit him and he be again alone <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0103__main__d3e19247"/>with<del eID="c57-0103__main__d3e19247"/><metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c57-0103.02">^</metamark><lb n="c57-0103__left_margin__1"/>exasperated by <lb n="c57-0103__main__23"/> the fresh provocation of being deserted <lb n="c57-0103__main__24"/> by one of his own species.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0103__main__25"/> Even if they were to leave Europe <lb n="c57-0103__main__26"/>& inhabit the desarts of the new world, <lb n="c57-0103__main__27"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0103__main__d3e19279"/>I<del eID="c57-0103__main__d3e19279"/> it was their intention to have children <lb n="c57-0103__main__28"/> and a race of devils would be propagated <lb n="c57-0103__main__29"/>upon the earth from whose form & mind <lb n="c57-0103__main__30"/> man shrunk with horro<mdel>w</mdel>r. <del rend="smear" sID="c57-0103__main__d3e19301"/>&<del eID="c57-0103__main__d3e19301"/> had I any right <lb n="c57-0103__main__31"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0103__main__d3e19309"/>for<del eID="c57-0103__main__d3e19309"/> for my own benefit to inflict this <lb n="c57-0103__main__32"/> curse to everlasting generations? I had <lb n="c57-0103__main__33"/> before been moved by the sophisms <lb n="c57-0103__main__34"/> of the being whom I had created; I had <lb n="c57-0103__main__35"/> been moved by his fiendish threats & now <lb n="c57-0103__main__36"/> for the first time the wickedness <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0103__main__d3e19323"/>& utter<del eID="c57-0103__main__d3e19323"/><lb n="c57-0104__main__1"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19338"/>selfishness<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19338"/><lb n="c57-0104__left_margin__1"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__left_margin__d3e19347"/>selfishness<del eID="c57-0104__left_margin__d3e19347"/> of my promise burst upo<mdel>m</mdel>n me; <lb n="c57-0104__main__2"/> I shud<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19366"/>d<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19366"/>ered to think that future ages might <lb n="c57-0104__main__3"/> curse me as their pest whose <lb n="c57-0104__main__4"/> had not hesitated to buy its own peace at <lb n="c57-0104__main__5"/> the price perhaps of the <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>existence of whole human <lb n="c57-0104__main__6"/> race. I trembled, and my heart failed <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19400"/>wh<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19400"/><lb n="c57-0104__main__7"/> within me, when on looking up I saw <lb n="c57-0104__main__8"/> by the light of the moon, the dæmon <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19409"/>with<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19409"/>at the <lb n="c57-0104__left_margin__1"/><del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0104__left_margin__d3e19423"/><del rend="smear" sID="c57-0104__left_margin__d3e19425"/>window<del eID="c57-0104__left_margin__d3e19425"/><del eID="c57-0104__left_margin__d3e19423"/>casement.<lb n="c57-0104__main__9"/> A ghastly grin <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19440"/>on his countena<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19440"/> wrinkled <lb n="c57-0104__main__10"/> lips, as he gazed on me <mdel>as</mdel>where I sat. Yes, he had <lb n="c57-0104__main__11"/> followed me in my travels; he had loitered <lb n="c57-0104__main__12"/> in forests, hid himself in caves or taken <lb n="c57-0104__main__13"/> refuge in wide & desart heaths & he <lb n="c57-0104__main__14"/> now came to view my progress & claim <lb n="c57-0104__main__15"/><lb n="c57-0104__left_margin__1"/> the fulfill<lb n="c57-0104__left_margin__2"/>ment of <lb n="c57-0104__left_margin__3"/><metamark function="separate">_________</metamark>my promise; as I looked on hi<mdel>s</mdel>m his <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19503"/>face<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19503"/>countenance<lb n="c57-0104__main__16"/><lb n="c57-0104__left_margin__1"/>appeared to express<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19523"/>ed<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19523"/> the utmost extent of malice <lb n="c57-0104__main__17"/>&<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19530"/>barbarity<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19530"/><mdel>:</mdel>treachery. I thought with a sensation <lb n="c57-0104__main__18"/> of <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19543"/>horror<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19543"/> madness <mdel>of</mdel>on my promise of crea<lb n="c57-0104__main__19"/>ting another like to him & trembling <lb n="c57-0104__main__20"/> with passion <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19564"/>as<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19564"/> tore to pieces the thing <lb n="c57-0104__main__21"/> on which I was engaged – The wretch <lb n="c57-0104__main__22"/> saw me destroy the creature on whose <lb n="c57-0104__main__23"/> future existence he depended for <lb n="c57-0104__main__24"/> happiness and with a howl of devi<lb n="c57-0104__main__25"/>lish despair <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>& revenge withdrew.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0104__main__26"/> I left the room & locking the door <lb n="c57-0104__main__27"/> made a vow in my own heart never <lb n="c57-0104__main__28"/> to resume my labours; & then with trem<lb n="c57-0104__main__29"/>bling steps I sought my own appartment <lb n="c57-0104__main__30"/> I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19615"/>a<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19615"/> was alone. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0104__main__d3e19618"/>n<del eID="c57-0104__main__d3e19618"/> None were near me to <lb n="c57-0104__main__31"/> dissipate the gloom and relieve me <lb n="c57-0104__main__32"/> from the most terrible reveries. Several <lb n="c57-0104__main__33"/> hours passed and I remained near my <lb n="c57-0104__main__34"/> window gazing on the sea. It was almost <lb n="c57-0104__main__35"/> motionless for the winds were hushed &<lb n="c57-0105__main__1"/> all nature reposed under the eye of the <lb n="c57-0105__main__2"/> quiet moon A few fishing<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0105__main__d3e19647"/>s<del eID="c57-0105__main__d3e19647"/> vessels alone <lb n="c57-0105__main__3"/> specked the water and now & then the <lb n="c57-0105__main__4"/> gentle breeze<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0105__main__d3e19655"/>d<del eID="c57-0105__main__d3e19655"/> wa<mdel>s</mdel>fted the sound of the <lb n="c57-0105__main__5"/> voices as the <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>fishermen called to one another. <lb n="c57-0105__main__6"/> I felt the silence although I was hardly <lb n="c57-0105__main__7"/> conscious of <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>its extreme profundity untill <lb n="c57-0105__main__8"/> my ear was suddenly arrested by <lb n="c57-0105__main__9"/> the paddling of oars near the shore <lb n="c57-0105__main__10"/> and a person landed close to my house. <lb n="c57-0105__main__11"/> In a few minutes after I heard the <lb n="c57-0105__main__12"/> creaking of my door as if some one <lb n="c57-0105__main__13"/> endeavoured to open it softly. I <lb n="c57-0105__main__14"/> trembled from head to foot; I felt a <lb n="c57-0105__main__15"/> presentiment of who it was and wished <lb n="c57-0105__main__16"/> to rouse one of the peasants who dwelt <lb n="c57-0105__main__17"/> in a cottage not far from mine. But <lb n="c57-0105__main__18"/> I was overcome by the <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0105__main__d3e19722"/>fright<del eID="c57-0105__main__d3e19722"/> sensation <lb n="c57-0105__main__19"/><lb n="c57-0105__left_margin__1"/>of helplessness so often felt in a fright<lb n="c57-0105__main__20"/>ful dream when you in vain endea<lb n="c57-0105__main__21"/>vour to fly the impending danger &<lb n="c57-0105__main__22"/> was rooted to the spot. Presently I heard <lb n="c57-0105__main__23"/> the sound of footsteps along the passage, <lb n="c57-0105__main__24"/><mdel>my</mdel><lb n="c57-0105__left_margin__1"/>the door opened & the wretch whom I <lb n="c57-0105__main__25"/> dreaded appeared. Shutting the door he <lb n="c57-0105__main__26"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0105__main__d3e19779"/>advanced towards<del eID="c57-0105__main__d3e19779"/><lb n="c57-0105__left_margin__1"/>approached me & said in a <lb n="c57-0105__main__27"/> smothered <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0105__main__d3e19796"/>v<del eID="c57-0105__main__d3e19796"/> voice:— You have des<lb n="c57-0105__main__28"/>-troyed the work that you began<mdel>.</mdel>; What <lb n="c57-0105__main__29"/> is it that you intend? Do you dare break <lb n="c57-0105__main__30"/> your promise? I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0105__main__d3e19819"/>h<del eID="c57-0105__main__d3e19819"/> have endured toil <lb n="c57-0105__main__31"/>& misery: I left Switzerland with you; <lb n="c57-0105__main__32"/> I crept along the shores of the Rhine <lb n="c57-0105__main__33"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0105__main__d3e19828"/>with you<del eID="c57-0105__main__d3e19828"/>, among its willow <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0105__main__d3e19832"/>ils<del eID="c57-0105__main__d3e19832"/> islands <lb n="c57-0105__main__34"/> and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0105__main__d3e19839"/>upon<del eID="c57-0105__main__d3e19839"/>over the summits of its hills. I have<lb n="c57-0106__main__1"/> dwelt many months in the heaths of England <lb n="c57-0106__main__2"/>& among the desarts of Scot<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0106__main__d3e19858"/>c<del eID="c57-0106__main__d3e19858"/>land. I have en<lb n="c57-0106__main__3"/>dured incalculable fatigue <mdel>,</mdel>& cold & hunger <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0106__main__d3e19877"/>&<del eID="c57-0106__main__d3e19877"/><lb n="c57-0106__main__4"/> do you dare destroy m<mdel>e</mdel>y hopes?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0106__main__5"/> Begone, I replied; I do break my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0106__main__d3e19896"/>p<del eID="c57-0106__main__d3e19896"/><lb n="c57-0106__main__6"/> promise; never will create another like <lb n="c57-0106__main__7"/> yourself, equal in deformity & wickedness.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0106__main__8"/> Slave, said the wretch, I before <lb n="c57-0106__main__9"/> reasoned with you – but you have proved <lb n="c57-0106__main__10"/> yourself unworthy of my condescen<mdel>t</mdel>sion. Remem<lb n="c57-0106__main__11"/>ber that I have power; you believe your<lb n="c57-0106__main__12"/>self miserable but I can make you so <lb n="c57-0106__main__13"/> wretched that the light of day <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0106__main__d3e19936"/>of d<del eID="c57-0106__main__d3e19936"/> will <lb n="c57-0106__main__14"/> be hateful to you. You are my creator <lb n="c57-0106__main__15"/> but I am your master; obey!<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0106__main__16"/> Wretch, said I, the hour of my weak<lb n="c57-0106__main__17"/>ness is past & the period of your power is <lb n="c57-0106__main__18"/> arrived. Your threats cannot move me <lb n="c57-0106__main__19"/> to do an act of wickedness but they confirm <lb n="c57-0106__main__20"/> me in a resolution of not creating you <lb n="c57-0106__main__21"/> companion in vice. Shall I in cold blood <lb n="c57-0106__main__22"/> set loose upon the earth a dæmon <lb n="c57-0106__main__23"/> whose delight is in death & wretchedness. <lb n="c57-0106__main__24"/> Begone, I am firm and your words will <lb n="c57-0106__main__25"/> only exasperate my rage.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0106__main__26"/> The Monster saw my determination <lb n="c57-0106__main__27"/> in my face and gnashed his teeth in the <lb n="c57-0106__main__28"/> impotence of anger. Shall each man, cried <lb n="c57-0106__main__29"/> he, find his equal, & each beast have <lb n="c57-0106__main__30"/> his mate <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0106__main__d3e19985"/>I<del eID="c57-0106__main__d3e19985"/> and I be alone. I had feelings <lb n="c57-0106__main__31"/> of affection & they were returned by detes<lb n="c57-0106__main__32"/>tation. Man you may hate, but beware!<lb n="c57-0107__main__1"/> Your hours will pass in dread & misery <lb n="c57-0107__main__2"/> and soon the bolt will fall which will <lb n="c57-0107__main__3"/> ravish from you your happiness for ever. <lb n="c57-0107__main__4"/> Are you to <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>be happy while I grovel in the <lb n="c57-0107__main__5"/> intensity of my wretchedness. You <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0107__main__d3e20030"/>destroy<del eID="c57-0107__main__d3e20030"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>can blast my <lb n="c57-0107__main__6"/> other passions but revenge remains; revenge <lb n="c57-0107__main__7"/> dearer than light or food. I may die but <lb n="c57-0107__main__8"/> first you my tyrant & tormentor shall <lb n="c57-0107__main__9"/> curse the sun that gazes on your misery. <lb n="c57-0107__main__10"/> Beware, for I am fearless & therefore <lb n="c57-0107__main__11"/> powerful. I will watch with the wiliness <lb n="c57-0107__main__12"/> of a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0107__main__d3e20058"/>snank<del eID="c57-0107__main__d3e20058"/> snake that I may sting with <lb n="c57-0107__main__13"/> its venom. Man, you shall repent <lb n="c57-0107__main__14"/> of the injuries you inflict.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0107__main__15"/> Devil, I cried, Cease, & do not <lb n="c57-0107__main__16"/> poison the air with those sounds <lb n="c57-0107__main__17"/> of malice. I have declared my resolution <lb n="c57-0107__main__18"/> to you and I am no coward to bend <lb n="c57-0107__main__19"/> beneath words – Leave me, I am inexo<lb n="c57-0107__main__20"/>rable.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0107__main__21"/> It is well, said he, I go; but remem<lb n="c57-0107__main__22"/>ber! I shall be with you on your <lb n="c57-0107__main__23"/> marriage night.<lb n="c57-0108__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0108.02" unit="tei:head"/>Chapter 13<shi rend="sup"></shi><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0108__main__2"/> I started forward & exclaimed—Villain, before <lb n="c57-0108__main__3"/> you sign my death-warrant, be sure that <lb n="c57-0108__main__4"/> you are yourself safe. I would have seized <lb n="c57-0108__main__5"/> him but he eluded me and quitting the house <lb n="c57-0108__main__6"/> with precipitation in a few moments I saw him <lb n="c57-0108__main__7"/> in his boat which shot across the waters with <lb n="c57-0108__main__8"/> an arrowy swiftness & was soon lost amidst the <lb n="c57-0108__main__9"/> waves.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0108__main__10"/> All was again silent; but his words rung in <lb n="c57-0108__main__11"/> my ears; I burnt with rage to pursue the <lb n="c57-0108__main__12"/> murderer of my peace & precipitate him into <lb n="c57-0108__main__13"/> the ocean. I walked up & down my room hastily <lb n="c57-0108__main__14"/>& perturbed, my imagination conjured before <lb n="c57-0108__main__15"/> me a thousand images <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0108__main__d3e20154"/>all<del eID="c57-0108__main__d3e20154"/> to torment & sting <lb n="c57-0108__main__16"/> me – Why <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0108__main__d3e20159"/>d<del eID="c57-0108__main__d3e20159"/> had I not followed him & closed with <lb n="c57-0108__main__17"/> him in<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0108__main__d3e20165"/>t<del eID="c57-0108__main__d3e20165"/> mortal strife–? But I had suffered <lb n="c57-0108__main__18"/> him to depart and he had directed his course <lb n="c57-0108__main__19"/> towards the main land; I shuddered to sup<lb n="c57-0108__main__20"/>pose who might be the next victim sacri<lb n="c57-0108__main__21"/>ficed to his insatiate revenge – And then <lb n="c57-0108__main__22"/> again I thought of his words – "<shi rend="underline">I will be with</shi><lb n="c57-0108__main__23"/><shi rend="underline">you on your marriage night</shi> That then <lb n="c57-0108__main__24"/> was the period fixed for the fulfillment <lb n="c57-0108__main__25"/> of my destiny – <mdel>o</mdel>In that <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>hour I should die and at <lb n="c57-0108__main__26"/> once satisfy and extinguish his malice. Yet <lb n="c57-0108__main__27"/> when I thought of Elizabeth The prospect did <lb n="c57-0108__main__28"/> not not move me to fear yet when I thought <lb n="c57-0108__main__29"/> of my beloved Elizabeth; of her tears & endless <lb n="c57-0108__main__30"/> sorrow when she should fin<mdel>e</mdel>d her lover <lb n="c57-0108__main__31"/> so barbarously snatched from her –tears <lb n="c57-0108__main__32"/> the first I had shed for many months, stream<lb n="c57-0108__main__33"/>ed from my eyes & I resolved not to fall before <lb n="c57-0108__main__34"/> my enemy without a bitter struggle.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0108__main__35"/> The night passed away & the sun rose <lb n="c57-0108__main__36"/> from the ocean – My feelings became calmer <lb n="c57-0108__main__37"/> if it may be called calmness when the <lb n="c57-0108__main__38"/> violence of rage sinks into the depths of<lb n="c57-0109__main__1"/> despair. I left the house, the horrid scene <lb n="c57-0109__main__2"/> of the last nights contention and wa<mdel>r</mdel>lked on <lb n="c57-0109__main__3"/> the beach of the sea which I almost regarded <lb n="c57-0109__main__4"/> as an insuperable barrier between me & my <lb n="c57-0109__main__5"/> fellow creatures. Nay a wish that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0109__main__d3e20306"/>that<del eID="c57-0109__main__d3e20306"/><mdel>mi</mdel>such was <lb n="c57-0109__main__6"/> the fact stole across me; I <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>wished that I might pass my <lb n="c57-0109__main__7"/> life on this barren rock wearily it is true <lb n="c57-0109__main__8"/> but uninterrupted by any sudden shock <lb n="c57-0109__main__9"/> of misery –If I returned <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>it was to be <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0109__main__d3e20349"/>myself a<del eID="c57-0109__main__d3e20349"/>sa<lb n="c57-0109__main__10"/>crificed or to see those I most loved die <lb n="c57-0109__main__11"/> under the grasp of a dæmon whom I <lb n="c57-0109__main__12"/> had myself created. I walked about the <lb n="c57-0109__main__13"/> isle like a restless spectre seperated from <lb n="c57-0109__main__14"/> all it loved & miserable in the seperation <lb n="c57-0109__main__15"/> When it became noon & the sun rose <lb n="c57-0109__main__16"/> higher I lay down <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0109__main__d3e20372"/>&<del eID="c57-0109__main__d3e20372"/> on the grass & was <lb n="c57-0109__main__17"/> overpowered by a deep sleep. I had been <lb n="c57-0109__main__18"/> awake the whole of the preceeding night, <lb n="c57-0109__main__19"/> my nerves were agitated & my eyes inflamed <lb n="c57-0109__main__20"/> with watching & misery. The sleep into which <lb n="c57-0109__main__21"/> I now sunk refreshed me & when I awoke <lb n="c57-0109__main__22"/> I again felt as if I belonged to a race of <lb n="c57-0109__main__23"/> human beings like myself & I began to <lb n="c57-0109__main__24"/> reflect upon what had passed with <lb n="c57-0109__main__25"/> greater composure —Yet still the words of <lb n="c57-0109__main__26"/> the fiend rung in my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0109__main__d3e20396"/>y<del eID="c57-0109__main__d3e20396"/>ears like a death <lb n="c57-0109__main__27"/> knell, they appeared like a dream, yet <lb n="c57-0109__main__28"/> distinct and oppressive as a reality.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0109__main__29"/> The <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0109__main__d3e20411"/>T<del eID="c57-0109__main__d3e20411"/> sun was far descended and I still <lb n="c57-0109__main__30"/> sat on the shore satisfying my ap<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>petite <lb n="c57-0109__main__31"/> which was become ravenous with an <lb n="c57-0109__main__32"/> oaten cake when I saw a fishing <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0109__main__d3e20433"/>boat<del eID="c57-0109__main__d3e20433"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0109__main__d3e20436"/>sk<del eID="c57-0109__main__d3e20436"/> boat <lb n="c57-0109__main__33"/> land close to me & one of the men brought <lb n="c57-0109__main__34"/> me a packet; it contained letters from <lb n="c57-0109__main__35"/> Geneva & one from Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval entreating me <lb n="c57-0109__main__36"/> to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0109__main__d3e20463"/>g<del eID="c57-0109__main__d3e20463"/> join him. He said <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0109__main__d3e20467"/>a<del eID="c57-0109__main__d3e20467"/> that nearly a<lb n="c57-0110__main__1"/> year had <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0110__main__d3e20482"/>passed<del eID="c57-0110__main__d3e20482"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>elapsed since we had quitted Switzerland <lb n="c57-0110__main__2"/> and France was yet unvisited. He entreated me <lb n="c57-0110__main__3"/> therefore to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0110__main__d3e20499"/>return<del eID="c57-0110__main__d3e20499"/> leave my solitary isle <lb n="c57-0110__main__4"/> and meet him at Perth in a week from that <lb n="c57-0110__main__5"/> time when we might arrange <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0110__main__d3e20507"/>our<del eID="c57-0110__main__d3e20507"/> the plan <lb n="c57-0110__main__6"/> of our future proceedings. This letter complete<lb n="c57-0110__main__7"/>ly recalled <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>me to life & I determined to quit my <lb n="c57-0110__main__8"/> island <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0110__main__d3e20533"/>the next day<del eID="c57-0110__main__d3e20533"/>. at the expiration of two days<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0110__main__9"/> Yet before I departed there was a task <lb n="c57-0110__main__10"/> to perform on which I shuddered to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0110__main__d3e20543"/>think<del eID="c57-0110__main__d3e20543"/><lb n="c57-0110__main__11"/><lb n="c57-0110__left_margin__1"/>reflect: I must pack my chemical instruments <lb n="c57-0110__main__12"/>& for that purpose I must enter the room <lb n="c57-0110__main__13"/> which had been the scene of my odious <lb n="c57-0110__main__14"/> work,& I must handle the utensils the sight <lb n="c57-0110__main__15"/> of which were sickening to me. The <lb n="c57-0110__main__16"/> next morning at daybreak I summoned <lb n="c57-0110__main__17"/> sufficient courage & unlocked the door <lb n="c57-0110__main__18"/> of my work room – The remains of the half fi<lb n="c57-0110__main__19"/>nished creature whom I had destroyed lay <lb n="c57-0110__main__20"/> scattered on the floor – & I almost felt as <lb n="c57-0110__main__21"/> if I had mangled the living flesh of a human <lb n="c57-0110__main__22"/> being. I paused to collect myself & then <lb n="c57-0110__main__23"/> entered the chamber. With trembling hands <lb n="c57-0110__main__24"/> I conveyed the instruments out of the room <lb n="c57-0110__main__25"/> but I reflected that I ought not to leave <lb n="c57-0110__main__26"/> the relicks of my work to excite the horror <lb n="c57-0110__main__27"/>& suspicion of the peasants and I accordingly put them <lb n="c57-0110__main__28"/> into a basket with a great quantity of <lb n="c57-0110__main__29"/> stones and tying it up determined to throw <lb n="c57-0110__main__30"/> them into the sea that very night and <lb n="c57-0110__main__31"/> in the mean time I sat on the beach em<lb n="c57-0110__main__32"/>ployed in cleaning & arranging my chemical <lb n="c57-0110__main__33"/> apparatus.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0110__main__34"/> Nothing <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0110__main__d3e20634"/>w<del eID="c57-0110__main__d3e20634"/> could be more complete than <lb n="c57-0110__main__35"/> the alteration that had taken place in<lb n="c57-0111__main__1"/> my feelings since the night of the ap<lb n="c57-0111__main__2"/>pearance of the dæmon. I had before <lb n="c57-0111__main__3"/> regarded my promise with gloomy despair <lb n="c57-0111__main__4"/> as a<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0111__main__d3e20660"/>n<del eID="c57-0111__main__d3e20660"/> thing that must <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0111__main__d3e20663"/>at<del eID="c57-0111__main__d3e20663"/> with whatever <lb n="c57-0111__main__5"/> consequences be fulfilled but I now felt <lb n="c57-0111__main__6"/> as if a film had been taken from before <lb n="c57-0111__main__7"/> my eyes & that I now for the first time <lb n="c57-0111__main__8"/> saw clearly. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0111__main__d3e20675"/>It never once<del eID="c57-0111__main__d3e20675"/> The idea of <lb n="c57-0111__main__9"/> renewing my labours did not for an <lb n="c57-0111__main__10"/> instant occur to me. The threat I had <lb n="c57-0111__main__11"/> heard weighed on my thoughts but I <del next="#c57-0111.02" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0111__main__d3e20684"/>never<del eID="c57-0111__main__d3e20684"/>did<lb n="c57-0111__main__12"/><lb n="c57-0111__left_margin__1"/>not reflect <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0111__main__d3e20703" xml:id="c57-0111.02"/>suppose<del eID="c57-0111__main__d3e20703"/><del rend="unmarked" sID="c57-0111__main__d3e20706"/>d<del eID="c57-0111__main__d3e20706"/> that a voluntary act of mine <lb n="c57-0111__main__13"/> might avert it. I had resolved in my <lb n="c57-0111__main__14"/> own mind that to create another like <lb n="c57-0111__main__15"/> the fiend I had first made would be <lb n="c57-0111__main__16"/> an act of the basest & most atrocious <lb n="c57-0111__main__17"/> selfishness and I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0111__main__d3e20723"/>did not<del eID="c57-0111__main__d3e20723"/> banished <lb n="c57-0111__main__18"/> from my mind every thought that <lb n="c57-0111__main__19"/> could lead to a different conclusion<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0111__main__20"/> Between two & three in the morning <lb n="c57-0111__main__21"/> the moon rose and I then putting my <lb n="c57-0111__main__22"/> basket into a little skiff sailed out about <lb n="c57-0111__main__23"/> four miles from the shore – The scene <lb n="c57-0111__main__24"/> was perfectly solitary, a few boats were <lb n="c57-0111__main__25"/> returning towards land but I sailed <lb n="c57-0111__main__26"/> away from them. I felt as if I was <lb n="c57-0111__main__27"/> about the commission of a dreadful <lb n="c57-0111__main__28"/> crime and avoided with shuddering <lb n="c57-0111__main__29"/> anxiety any encounter with my fellow <lb n="c57-0111__main__30"/> creatures. At one time the moon which <lb n="c57-0111__main__31"/> had before been clear was suddenly <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0111__main__d3e20761"/>covered<del eID="c57-0111__main__d3e20761"/><lb n="c57-0111__main__32"/> overspread by a thick cloud &<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>I took advan<lb n="c57-0111__main__33"/>tage of the moment of darkness & cast<lb n="c57-0112__main__1"/> the basket into the sea – I listened to the gurg<lb n="c57-0112__main__2"/>ling sound as it sunk & then <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>sailed away from the <lb n="c57-0112__main__3"/> spot. The sky had become clouded but the <lb n="c57-0112__main__4"/> air was pure although <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20818"/>a<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20818"/> chilled by the <lb n="c57-0112__main__5"/> North-East breeze that was rising. But <lb n="c57-0112__main__6"/> it refreshed & filled me with such agreable <lb n="c57-0112__main__7"/> sensations that I resolved to prolong <lb n="c57-0112__main__8"/> my stay on the water &<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20832"/>leaving<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20832"/>fixing the rudder <lb n="c57-0112__main__9"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><lb n="c57-0112__left_margin__1"/>in a direct position stretched myself at the bottom of the boat. <lb n="c57-0112__main__10"/> Clouds hid the moon, every thing was obscure <lb n="c57-0112__main__11"/>& I heard only the sound of the boat as it <lb n="c57-0112__main__12"/> keel cut through the waves–The sound <lb n="c57-0112__main__13"/> lulled me–& in a short time I slept <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20872"/>s<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20872"/><lb n="c57-0112__main__14"/> soundly<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0112__main__15"/> I do not know how long I remained in <lb n="c57-0112__main__16"/> this situation but when I awoke I found <lb n="c57-0112__main__17"/> that the sun had already mounted considerably– <lb n="c57-0112__main__18"/> The wind was high and the waves <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20888"/>th<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20888"/> continually <lb n="c57-0112__main__19"/> threatened the safety of my little <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20893"/>boat<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20893"/> skiff— <lb n="c57-0112__main__20"/> I <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20899"/>endeavoure<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20899"/> found that the wind wasnorth-<lb n="c57-0112__main__21"/>east and must have driven me far <lb n="c57-0112__main__22"/> from the coast from which I had embarked. <lb n="c57-0112__main__23"/> I endeavoured to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20915"/>turn<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20915"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20918"/>the<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20918"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20927"/>boat<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20927"/>change my course but <lb n="c57-0112__main__24"/> quickly found that if I again <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>made the attempt<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20948"/>ed<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20948"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20951"/>it<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20951"/><lb n="c57-0112__main__25"/> the boat would be instantl<mdel>ey</mdel>y filled with <lb n="c57-0112__main__26"/> water. Thus situated my only resource was <lb n="c57-0112__main__27"/> to drive before the wind – <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20970"/>To be a<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20970"/> I confess <lb n="c57-0112__main__28"/> that I felt a few sensations of terror –I had <lb n="c57-0112__main__29"/> no compass with me and was so little <lb n="c57-0112__main__30"/> acquainted with the geography of this part <lb n="c57-0112__main__31"/> of the world that the sun was of little be<lb n="c57-0112__main__32"/>nefit to me –I might be <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0112__main__d3e20989"/>driv<del eID="c57-0112__main__d3e20989"/> driven into <lb n="c57-0112__main__33"/> the wide Atlantic & feel all the tortures <lb n="c57-0112__main__34"/> of starvation or be swallowed up in <lb n="c57-0112__main__35"/> immeasurable waters that roared &<lb n="c57-0113__main__1"/> buffeted around me. I had already been out <lb n="c57-0113__main__2"/> many hours and felt the tortures of a <lb n="c57-0113__main__3"/> burning thirst a prelude to my other <lb n="c57-0113__main__4"/> sufferings – I looked on the heavens which <lb n="c57-0113__main__5"/> was covered by clouds that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0113__main__d3e21017"/>pass<del eID="c57-0113__main__d3e21017"/> flew <lb n="c57-0113__main__6"/> with the wind only to be replaced by others– <lb n="c57-0113__main__7"/> I looked on the sea – It was to be my grave. <lb n="c57-0113__main__8"/> Fiend, I exclaimed, your task is already <lb n="c57-0113__main__9"/> fulfilled—I thought of Elizabeth of my <lb n="c57-0113__main__10"/> father & of Cl<mdel>ai</mdel>erval – & sunk into a reverie <lb n="c57-0113__main__11"/> so despairing & frightful that even now <lb n="c57-0113__main__12"/> when the scene is on the point of closing <lb n="c57-0113__main__13"/> before me for ever I shudder to reflect <lb n="c57-0113__main__14"/> on it.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0113__main__15"/> Some hours passed thus–But by <lb n="c57-0113__main__16"/> degrees, as the sun <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0113__main__d3e21057"/>verged<del eID="c57-0113__main__d3e21057"/>declined towards the <lb n="c57-0113__main__17"/> horizon, the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0113__main__d3e21068"/>breezed<del eID="c57-0113__main__d3e21068"/>wind died away into <lb n="c57-0113__main__18"/> a gentle breeze and the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0113__main__d3e21078"/>breakers ce<del eID="c57-0113__main__d3e21078"/> sea <lb n="c57-0113__main__19"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0113__main__d3e21086"/>was smothed<del eID="c57-0113__main__d3e21086"/> became free from breakers. <lb n="c57-0113__main__20"/> But these gave place to a heavy swell, <lb n="c57-0113__main__21"/> I felt sick & hardly able to hold the rud<lb n="c57-0113__main__22"/>der when suddenly I saw a line of <lb n="c57-0113__main__23"/> high land towards the south. Almost <lb n="c57-0113__main__24"/> spent as I was by fatigue & misery this <lb n="c57-0113__main__25"/> sudden certainty of life rushed like a <lb n="c57-0113__main__26"/> warm joy to my heart and tears gush <lb n="c57-0113__main__27"/> ed from my eyes. How mutable are our <lb n="c57-0113__main__28"/> feelings & how strange is that clinging love <lb n="c57-0113__main__29"/> we have of life even in the excess of <lb n="c57-0113__main__30"/> misery. I steered my boat towards the shore <lb n="c57-0113__main__31"/> and<lb n="c57-0113__left_margin__1"/> I constructed another sail with a <lb n="c57-0113__main__32"/> part of my dress & eagerly st<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>eered my course <lb n="c57-0113__main__33"/> towards the lan<mdel/>d. It had a wild rocky<lb n="c57-0114__main__1"/> appearance but as I approached nearer I <lb n="c57-0114__main__2"/> easily perceived the traces of cultivation –I saw <lb n="c57-0114__main__3"/> vessels near the shore & found myself sud<lb n="c57-0114__main__4"/>denly transported back to the neighborhood <lb n="c57-0114__main__5"/> of civilized man – I eagerly <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21194"/>viewed<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21194"/>traced the windings <lb n="c57-0114__main__6"/> of the <mdel>s</mdel><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21208"/>hor<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21208"/><mdel>e</mdel>land& hailed a steeple which after <lb n="c57-0114__main__7"/> sailing I at length saw issueing from <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21225"/>ani<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21225"/> behi<mdel>d</mdel>nd <lb n="c57-0114__main__8"/> a small promontory – As I was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21242"/>fainting<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21242"/> in <lb n="c57-0114__main__9"/> a st<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21248"/>r<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21248"/>ate of extreme debility from fasting <lb n="c57-0114__main__10"/> I resolved to go directly towards the town <lb n="c57-0114__main__11"/> as a place where could most easily pro<lb n="c57-0114__main__12"/>cure<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21262"/>f<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21262"/> nourishment– Fortunately I <mdel/>had <lb n="c57-0114__main__13"/> money with me.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0114__main__14"/> As I turned the promontory I discovered <lb n="c57-0114__main__15"/> a small neat town – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21285"/>a<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21285"/> and a good harbour <lb n="c57-0114__main__16"/> which I entered, my heart bounding with <lb n="c57-0114__main__17"/> joy at my unexpected escape. <milestone unit="tei:p"/><metamark function="paragraph">[</metamark>As I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21298"/>fi<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21298"/> was <lb n="c57-0114__main__18"/> occupied in fixing the boat and ar arranging <lb n="c57-0114__main__19"/> the sails several people crowded towards <lb n="c57-0114__main__20"/> the spot – They appeared very much much <lb n="c57-0114__main__21"/> surprised at my appearance <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21313"/>and<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21313"/> but <lb n="c57-0114__main__22"/> instead of offering me any assistance <lb n="c57-0114__main__23"/> whispered together <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21320"/>in<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21320"/> with gestures that <lb n="c57-0114__main__24"/> at any other time might have produced <lb n="c57-0114__main__25"/> in me a slight sensation of alarm –as it <lb n="c57-0114__main__26"/> was I merely remarked <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21330"/>th<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21330"/> that it was <lb n="c57-0114__main__27"/> English, that they spoke and therefore <lb n="c57-0114__main__28"/> addressed them; My Good Friends, said I, Will you <lb n="c57-0114__main__29"/> be<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21339"/>so<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21339"/> so kind as to tell me what the name <lb n="c57-0114__main__30"/> of this <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21347"/>place<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21347"/>town is; & where I am.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0114__main__31"/> You will know that soon enough, re<lb n="c57-0114__main__32"/>plied a<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0114__main__d3e21365"/>n<del eID="c57-0114__main__d3e21365"/> man with a gruff voice; May be <lb n="c57-0114__main__33"/> you are come to a place that will <lb n="c57-0114__main__34"/> not prove much to your taste – But<lb n="c57-0115__main__1"/> you will not be consulted as to your <lb n="c57-0115__main__2"/> quarters, I promise you—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0115__main__3"/><del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21388"/>My<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21388"/> I was exceedingly surprized at receiv<lb n="c57-0115__main__4"/>ing so rude an answer from a stranger <lb n="c57-0115__main__5"/> and I was also disconcerted on perceiving the<lb n="c57-0115__main__6"/>the countenance of this man an his <lb n="c57-0115__main__7"/> companions frow<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>ning and angry countenances <lb n="c57-0115__main__8"/> of his companions – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21426"/>Why<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21426"/> Why do you answer <lb n="c57-0115__main__9"/> me so roughly, I replied Surely <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21432"/>as En<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21432"/> it <lb n="c57-0115__main__10"/> is not the custom of Englishmen to receive <lb n="c57-0115__main__11"/> strangers <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21439"/>in<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21439"/> so inhospitably.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0115__main__12"/> I do not know, said the man, what <lb n="c57-0115__main__13"/> the custom of the English may be but <lb n="c57-0115__main__14"/> it is the custom of the Irish to hate <lb n="c57-0115__main__15"/> villains. <milestone unit="tei:p"/><metamark function="paragraph">[</metamark>While this strange dialogue <lb n="c57-0115__main__16"/> continued I perceived the croud <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21467"/>en<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21467"/> rapidly <lb n="c57-0115__main__17"/> encrease. Their <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21474"/>countenances<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21474"/>faces expressed <lb n="c57-0115__main__18"/> a mixture of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21483"/>ang<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21483"/> curiosity & anger <lb n="c57-0115__main__19"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21489"/>wit<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21489"/> which an<mdel>oy</mdel>noyed & in so<mdel>n</mdel>me degree <lb n="c57-0115__main__20"/> alarmed me. I enquired the way to the inn <lb n="c57-0115__main__21"/> but no one replied – I then moved foward <lb n="c57-0115__main__22"/> and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21517"/>a buz arose<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21517"/> a murmuring noise <lb n="c57-0115__main__23"/> rose from the croud <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21522"/>the<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21522"/> as they followed <lb n="c57-0115__main__24"/>& surrounded me— when an ill looking <lb n="c57-0115__main__25"/> man comming forward– tapped me on <lb n="c57-0115__main__26"/> the shoulder & said – Come, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0115__main__d3e21532"/>yo<del eID="c57-0115__main__d3e21532"/> Sir, You <lb n="c57-0115__main__27"/> must follow me to Mr. Kirwins to give <lb n="c57-0115__main__28"/> an account of yourself.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0115__main__29"/> Who is M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin, said I, & why am <lb n="c57-0115__main__30"/> I to give an account of myself.–is not <lb n="c57-0115__main__31"/> this a free country?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0115__main__32"/> Aye, Sir, replied the man, free enough <lb n="c57-0115__main__33"/> for honest folks. M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin is a magis<lb n="c57-0115__main__34"/>trate& you are to give an account of<lb n="c57-0116__main__1"/> the death of a gentleman who was found murdered <lb n="c57-0116__main__2"/> here last night.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0116__main__3"/> This answer startled <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>me, But I presently <lb n="c57-0116__main__4"/> recovered myself. I was innocent & that could <lb n="c57-0116__main__5"/> easily be proved – accordingly I followed my con<lb n="c57-0116__main__6"/>ductor in silence & was led to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0116__main__d3e21606"/>wha<del eID="c57-0116__main__d3e21606"/> one o<mdel>n</mdel>f the <lb n="c57-0116__main__7"/> best houses in the town. I was ready to sink from <lb n="c57-0116__main__8"/> fatigue & hunger, but bein<mdel/>g surrounded by <lb n="c57-0116__main__9"/> a croud I thought it politic to rouse all <lb n="c57-0116__main__10"/> my strength that no physical debility might <lb n="c57-0116__main__11"/> be construed into apprehension <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0116__main__d3e21647"/>&<del eID="c57-0116__main__d3e21647"/> or cons<lb n="c57-0116__main__12"/>cious guilt. Little did I then expect the <lb n="c57-0116__main__13"/> calamity that would in a few moments <lb n="c57-0116__main__14"/> overwhelm me, and <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>extinguish in horror & despair <lb n="c57-0116__main__15"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0116__main__d3e21675"/>extinguish<del eID="c57-0116__main__d3e21675"/> all fear of ignominy or death— <lb n="c57-0116__main__16"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0116__main__d3e21681"/>The sun & ea<del eID="c57-0116__main__d3e21681"/> I must pause <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0116__main__d3e21684"/>for the<del eID="c57-0116__main__d3e21684"/><lb n="c57-0116__main__17"/><del rend="unmarked" sID="c57-0116__main__d3e21689"/>sc<del eID="c57-0116__main__d3e21689"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0116__main__d3e21692"/>ene which I shall now relate<del eID="c57-0116__main__d3e21692"/>for it requires <lb n="c57-0116__main__18"/>& strength to suffer <lb n="c57-0116__main__19"/> me to recall <del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0116__main__d3e21719"/>its<del eID="c57-0116__main__d3e21719"/>the frightful images <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>of the events which<lb n="c57-0116__left_margin__1"/> I am about <lb n="c57-0116__left_margin__2"/> to relate in in <lb n="c57-0116__main__20"/> proper detail to my recollection.
